revised_title: A Sad Effect of Thunder and Lightning: The Tragic Fate of Mr. Brooks
tldr: In January 1665, a man named Mr. Brooks was tragically killed by lightning while riding his horse near Winchester. His clothes were burned off, and his body was severely injured. This event was documented by Thomas Neale, who shared the story with a friend in London. The account is similar to other historical cases of people being struck by lightning and serves as a reminder of the dangers of thunderstorms.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Natural Disasters
